intro: Anastrophus platyculmus, commonly known as the flat-leaf anastrophus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and yellow, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Anastrophus platyculmus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
